attributes.action: Give fathers automatic parental responsibility
attributes.background:
Mothers get automatic parental responsibility for a child but fathers do not
Fathers are not second class citizens and fathers helped create the child as much as the mother did

 it feels very sexist and discriminative against fathers

attributes.action: Increased sentences for assaulting a police officer.
attributes.background: The police do a difficult and quite often thankless job in order to keep our communities safe, all too often this can be a very dangerous job.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the sentence for assaulting a police officer ranges from a from a fine to a maximum of 6 months in prison. 

Recently a police officer in the West Midlands police was assaulted and had a large chunk of hair ripped from her head whilst attending a domestic incident, her attacker received a paltry 12 weeks suspended sentence. 
https://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-01-12/police-woman-has-hair-ripped-out-after-being-assaulted-on-shift/ 

This kind of lenient sentencing will only serve to demoralise the police when they should be given full support from the courts. I therefore propose that a minimum custodial sentence of 18 months be introduced for any assault on a police officer.

attributes.action: Make the National Speed Limit 80mph.
attributes.background: The motor way is used by drivers to get to further destinations quickly. Having a speed limit is already limiting its use and having an abundance of speed cameras is further limiting it. Making the NSL 80mph will at least contribute to a quicker journey time amongst all these other limitations.
attributes.additional_details:
More car accidents are had on regular roads.
Speed cameras are on many roads where crashes aren't even a problem. 
Amongst restricted parking, restricted roads and roads being flooded with traffic lights, traffic is a problem. Speed cameras further increase this as people slow down just for these cameras.

attributes.action: Cyclists to wear mandatory cycling helmet, high viz vest and front light.
attributes.background: A lack of legislation to cyclists poses risk to pedestrians and to other road users due to their lack of visibility. The government should pass a legislation for mandatory wear of cycling helmet, high visibility vest and a front regulated light permanently switched-on at all time while cycling.

attributes.action: Remove police cautions from criminal records after 10 years.
attributes.background: A lot of people have accepted a police caution in the past after being told by the police that it isn't the same as a criminal conviction and it wont appear on their criminal record, only to find many years later that it appears on advanced criminal record checks affecting their ability to work.

attributes.action: Keep the Panavia Tornado in service for another few years
attributes.background: The Tornado is one of the most capable and advanced strike aircraft currently fielded by any air force today, and RAF Tornados are currently conducting airstrikes on insurgents in the Middle East, and the Tornado will be kept in service by Germany until 2025, so why can’t we?

attributes.action: Fund research into Granuloma Annulare
attributes.background: Granuloma Annulare is a skin condition which causes an unsightly rash and severe itching and there is no known cure for it.
attributes.additional_details: I run a Facebook page for this condition and have hundreds of members all who are getting nowhere in the UK when they go to see a dermatologist. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Stop charging for Vehicle Excise Duty
attributes.background:
The government wastes taxpayer money by collecting vehicle excise duty in the form of a tax on the car.
Instead the revenue currently generated through VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year £100 million worth of VED goes unpaid through evasion.
Car insurance and MOT details are now held on a central register so the outdated requirement to provide these documents when taxing a car is un-necesaary. 
VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold, this would create a simple and unavoidable way of collecting the revenue. It would also encourage people to buy fuel efficient cars therefore helping the environment.

attributes.action: Ban all stand alone ATM’s
attributes.background: Everyday the news and social media are reporting on the increasing crime of Ram Raids on shops for the stand alone cash machines (ATM). Some of these shops have been targeted more than once. This has to stop, and the only way we can help, is to have the stand alone machines removed from shops now.
attributes.additional_details: The Police can only advise shopkeepers on security and not enforce it, and the stand alone ATM’s do not have trackers fitted or ‘Smart’ Water. I am asking for these cash machines to be removed from shops, and the initial temptation for these criminals will also be removed. Livelihoods, jobs, are all disrupted. Bank / Post office branch cash machines are better installed and are rarely raided, we live in a world where we pay for things via apps, so cash is not that essential.

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: Fund higher-level classes for profoundly gifted GCSE students
attributes.background: Many highly intelligent pupils feel abandoned by their secondary schools in the UK. Their ability to work and absorb new information at faster rate results in the majority of their time in school being unproductive, wasting time that should be spent realising their potential in academia.

attributes.action: Create a ‘Residential Care Voucher’ scheme
attributes.background: As a parent to a young child, I can take advantage of the tax-efficient way to pay towards her childcare. I propose a similar scheme be set up so that people can save towards the often unmanageable costs surrounding residential care for elderly loved ones.
attributes.additional_details:
A scheme should exist where:
Employees can pay into a ‘pot’ that is dedicated to the residential / end-of-life care of loved ones.
Monies saved are protected by a government-backed scheme (similar to savings at the bank)
Savings to the employee are present through salary-sacrifice
Monies deposited  are available should they become not necessary
People can chose to pay into their own account and/or an account for a relative/friend 

The scheme should mirror the current childcare voucher scheme

attributes.action: Reduce the tax on cigarettes and return cigarettes to old packaging
attributes.background: I don't think I need to explain the price hikes that have gone on in recent years on cigarettes, but the announcement of Phillip Hammond wanting to Raise prices again is a step to far, I suggest in this petition to remove all pre tax on cigarettes so they are just the 20% sales tax as standard
attributes.additional_details: Akin to this is the packaging rule which has caused problems throughout UK supermarkets of tellers handing customers wrong brands then refusing exchanges, is there any evidence that this reduces smoking in youth? Because I have seen no difference

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on switching the British election system over to MMP
attributes.background: The British FPTP election system has lead to an unproportional Parliament not representing the wants of the British people with parties being able to get a majority with just 30 precent of the vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have never voted on a truly proportional voting system with AV being heavily flawed and with the referendum in question having a turn out of just 40% many voters wanted something else. MMP keeps constituencies and thus the constituent link.
Source:https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixed-member_proportional_representation

attributes.action: Make all cyclists wear helmets and have insurance cover a legal requirement.
attributes.background: All cyclists should have to wear an approved standard helmet to reduce head injury if they come off their bikes.  They should also have to have insurance cover in case they damage, injure a third party or other vehicle. As at present there is no easy method to get a cyclist to pay for damage caused.
attributes.additional_details: Cyclist need to be protected from themselves in the same way that drivers were protected from themselves by the introduction of safety laws  (wearing seat belts). This would reduce deaths and the cost of health care levied on the NHS.  Cyclist should have insurance cover to ride on the road so if they inadvertently cause damage to another vehicle or person, then that person or vehicle damaged will have a simple method of recovering damages without having to go through a costly legal process.

attributes.action: Make voting in local & general elections compulsory.
attributes.background: The 'turn-out' at local government elections is abysmal. The resultant problem is that small groups that are motivated by a covert agenda may succeed. A 'fixed penalty' for failing to vote - as applies in Australia & N.Z. - might provide an extra incentive to vote.
attributes.additional_details: District & County Councillors, School Governors, are being elected by a tiny number of electors. Called upon to administer complex issues & substantial budgets, they may be - at best - incompetent, at worst be driven by a motive contrary to that desired by the majority. The ballot slip should include a box labelled 'none of the above', but anyone on the electoral roll who doesn't vote should have to pay a fixed penalty - say £50. Voting 'on line' should also be possible.

attributes.action: Pressure the Iraqi government to acknowledge the Kurdish referendum result.
attributes.background: On the 25th September Kurdistan (a region of Iraq) held a referendum on becoming an independent nation and autonomous state. After years of persecution, the Kurds voted for independence. Yet the Iraqi government fail to recognise the result and use troops to suppress the call for independence.

attributes.action: Abolish the 60% stealth income tax
attributes.background: The effective income tax rate for earnings of £100,000 - £123,000 is 60%, as the tax free allowance drops away. So the tax rate goes from 40% for earnings under £100,000, up to 60%, and then back down to 40% for earnings between £123,000 and £150,000. Truly bizzare.
attributes.additional_details: This tax rate is a clear disincentive for those earning around £100,000 (mainly those seen as "wealth creators"). So much so that the vast majority will surely act to avoid this rate (e.g. By paying into their pensions). This is dragging liquidity away from the market and therefore adversely affecting everyone in the country.

attributes.action: Scrap driving theory test
attributes.background: The theory test is a waste of time, effort and most importantly money. I think it should be removed for good.

attributes.action: Commit to a long-term funding plan for health & social care to the year 2035.
attributes.background: We are calling on the government to recognise the rising demand, underfunding and workforce crisis in the NHS and social care sector by committing to a long-term funding plan for health and social care to the year 2035.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is supported by the NHS Confederation.

attributes.action: Ban disposable coffee cups as people are unaware of their impact on environment.
attributes.background: In the UK we use 7 million coffee cups every day. Even though coffee cups are classified as recyclable, only 1 per 400 cups is able to go through the recycling process the rest go into landfill due to the way they are manufactured. To protect our environment the government need to take action.
attributes.additional_details:
The action which could be taken would be for the government to look into Eco-friendly options to replace the coffee cup. 

The government also need to raise awareness to all consumers of disposable hot drinks, that, although they are supposed to be disposable, in reality very few are, because they cannot be recycled.

attributes.action: Create a UK disabled/pensioner's bus pass that works across the whole UK.
attributes.background: Create a bus pass, like in Scotland/England/Wales where disabled and elderly people can travel for free but make it so that it works across the whole UK, not cutting out at a certain place because it's in a different part of the UK or not working because you are not in the country your you live in.
attributes.additional_details: For example a bus pass from Scotland not working in England/Wales or Vice Versa.  A whole UK one instead or as well as so it works everywhere and borders aren't an issue.

attributes.action: Issue a statement condemning democratic rights violations in Poland and Hungary
attributes.background: The Polish and Hungarian governments have undermined democracy in their respective countries. Poland has compromised the independence of the judiciary, while Hungary has restricted freedom of the press and the funding of pro-democracy NGOs. The UK Government should speak out against this.
attributes.additional_details: As evidence, we can note that the EU commission has begun proceedings against both countries due to Hungary’s violations of citizens’ rights under the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights, and Poland’s violation of the rule of law under Article 2 of the Treaty on European Union. The UK Government remains silent on the issue, when it should act to protect democracy in Europe for the sake of peace, prosperity, and justice.

attributes.action: Make Transverse Myelitis recognisable on all life and health insurance policies!
attributes.background: Transverse myelitis is the sister illness to MS! However is unrecognised in mainstream private health and life insurance policies! Which means I can’t protect my family if something happened to me! Please sign the petition to make it a legal requirement to add this illness to the list! Thank you.

attributes.action: Change planning laws. Everyone should have a say and be heard.
attributes.background: If a local resident affected by a planning application requests a meeting, planning officers and councillors must meet them to discuss their concerns before a decision is made. Council officers discuss planning applications for months with developers and their army of planning consultants.
attributes.additional_details: They must talk to us as well. The current situation is fundamentally undemocratic and wrong. A developer made a planning application for a supermarket down my little street. There is no parking, huge lorries will make deliveries and we were concerned our tiny road would not be big enough. Nobody in planning would listen to us. Elected councillors refused to discuss the planning application. My objection comments went unread: I was denied a voice: I was silenced.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for security staff to have a body-worn camera.
attributes.background: Due to the nature of some security staff otherwise known as 'bouncers', it has become clear to me that a body worn camera is needed for the safety and security of both parties.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone who has been to an event of some kind knows of one or more stories of something going wrong when trying to get into the event. If evidence such as video can be reviewed then a better outcome can come of the incident.

attributes.action: Change business rates for child care providers and make them zero VAT rated.
attributes.background: Childcare has recently faced huge increases in business rates for their properties. Coupled with this, they pay VAT on purchases but are unable to reclaim this to offset against the business. Along with increased minimum wage, pensions, and 30 hours funding this is leaving them financially unstable.
attributes.additional_details:
With the onset of the Government scheme to offer 30 hours "free" childcare to parents, the minimum funding leaves the childcare provider liable to make up the shortfall. Increases in business rates & VAT charges are making this unsustainable for childcare providers. Maintained providers are already able to claim taxes paid under Section 33 of the VAT Act 1994.
The removal of business rates & VAT rating would enable providers to continue to provide the services required without financial burden

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Make the using mobile phone whilst driving punishment the same as drink driving.
attributes.background: I see at least 10 people a day using their phone whilst driving they are not concentrating on the road or they're holding the traffic up because they are too busy looking at their phone. The ban should be the same as drink driving because they are not looking at the road.

attributes.action: New law on the ratio of qualified staff/carers to patients in nursing homes
attributes.background: My father was neglected in a care home. There is no minimum legal ratio or a requirement on public or private care facilities to employ a minimum number of staff. I have spent 5 years speaking, researching and gleaning information on this matter.
attributes.additional_details: I had to employ the services of my local MP who contacted The Care Quality Commission on my behalf. I should have been listened to immediately and my concerns taken seriously without having to involve my MP. I have spoken with many carers/qualified nursing staff in nursing homes and in the community, and they believe, that there is neglect is because there is no legal ratio requirement.

attributes.action: Make car insurance companies give their "BEST PRICE" when they send your renewal
attributes.background:
I received my car insurance renewal and it went up by £100, I shopped around and got a better price, I then called my current insurers and following some haggling they dropped the premiums by 23%.
I want the government to make insurers give their "BEST PRICE" on the renewal and not make you haggle

attributes.action: Make a guarantee for no physical checks at NI side of border nor between GB & NI
attributes.background: The departure from the EU Customs Union means bilateral customs checks between ROI and UK, UK has promised unilaterally no physical border checks from its side between NI and ROI and NI and GB, this promise should be made into a legal guarantee as part of the so called "Great Repeal Bill".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-northern-ireland-border-brexit-eu-hard-no-deal-cabinet-irish-a8235096.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/irish-hard-border-soft-brexit-technology-theresa-may-a8242461.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-43277181

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/09/uk-must-set-stone-commitment-no-hard-irish-border-brexit-talks/

https://news.sky.com/story/government-wants-no-changes-to-irish-border-arrangements-10991079

attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Make two modest but sensible precautions in case Brexit goes badly.
attributes.background:
Precaution 1.  Hold a post-Brexit referendum on whether to return to the EU.  

Precaution 2.  Ensure our Brexit Terms include the right for a "fast-track" return of the UK to the EU, ideally under pre-Brexit conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
If that new shirt doesn’t quite fit, we can return it to the shop.  To make sure we don’t lose those precious family photos, we back-up the laptop from time to time. 

So if rights-of-return and back-up plans make sense for an individual, shouldn't a nation of 65 million people have a contingency plan just in case Brexit is not the resounding success we all hope for?

No-one on either side of the argument has a crystal ball, so can we afford not to have an insurance policy in our back pocket?

attributes.action: Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
attributes.background:
We have many paedophile hunting groups trying to tackle this problem 
Protecting our children should be priority number one
attributes.additional_details:
Currently over 100 hunting groups in the UK because the Police don't have the resources
Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
We have Parents taking to the streets in a bid to expose online predators because our current system does not scratch the surface

attributes.action: Ban credit cards being used for gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling effects many people,  causes anxiety, depression and can lead to suicide. By banning using credit cards for gambling it ensures anyone who is gambling has the money to do so.

attributes.action: Police officers should be allowed spit hoods as part of their kit.
attributes.background: At the moment police officers can only use a spit hood in the custody footprint ie in the yard, cage or in custody. Imagine having to do a hospital guard for 8 hours with someone spitting at you and constantly threatening to spit at you.
attributes.additional_details: There are significant health risks through spitting a Ukrainian police officer contracted tuberculosis in 2016 and died. You are also at risk of hep b and hep c as well as cold and flu viruses.

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum stake of £2 for fixed odds betting machines (FOBTS)
attributes.background:
Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this

B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds. There should be a legal maximum stake of £2 to protect people who are addicted to gambling.
attributes.additional_details:
Betting can be fun, but addiction isn't.
 
When the fun stops, stop. The fun has stopped - there are over 400,000 problem gamblers, with more than 2 million 'at risk' - so stop the FOBTs.
 
A £2 maximum stake (as already is in place on b3 games/ 'slots') would still allow serious, but stable gamblers to  win big, but not on the 'crack-cocaine' of gambling. 

We call on the Government to take this action to protect vulnerable people and to fix the problem in gambling.

attributes.action: Enforce the same rules for reclaimed stone as scrap metal, reducing theft.
attributes.background: There is a significant increase in the theft of stone, particularly wall copings (tops) and flags. These are taken and sold to reclaimed yards.  Law should be introduced the same as for scrap metal, ensuring people selling to identify themselves and payments are made to bank accounts only. No Cash

attributes.action: Devolve responsibility for immigration policy in Scotland.
attributes.background: It looks like the EU migrants are now leaving the UK after Brexit and we don’t want that.  So, I call on the UK government to devolve some powers over immigration, especially the responsibility over immigration policy to the Scottish Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: We, Scots welcome immigrants to come and live in Scotland, and work in Scotland, when England doesn’t.  We welcome especially EU migrants, who pay their taxes raised in Scotland and contribute to our economy and if they go, we will miss out.  So we need them.  I know we haven’t known about this before, but countries like Canada and Australia have regional/provincial immigration policies within a nation-wide framework.

attributes.action: Naturalisation fees should be reduced significantly, especially for refugees.
attributes.background: Paying fees for Naturalisation or Citizenship, became a nightmare for all people and especially refugees. Family of 5 people have to pay around £6000 to 7000.

attributes.action: All new build homes built in the last 5 years to be granted freehold interest.
attributes.background: Adverse publicity of developers including unreasonable clauses within leases on new houses has led to government consultation.  Developers should not hold power over new home buyers upon legal completion of the house.  People who buy a new build house want to be freeholders not tenants!

attributes.action: Ensure electric kick scooters are legal in cycle lanes
attributes.background: Government should clarify whether or not current law allows electric kick scooters in cycle lanes. If it doesn’t, it should change the law so that they are. These scooters are great way to get about and a good way to reduce pollution and numbers of bicycles locked to every free space possible.
attributes.additional_details:
- In emergency situations the user can get off/dismount the PELV at any time compared to electric bikes.
 
- They only use 250 watts which is exactly the same as an electric bike and travel at 8-12 mph.
 
- You are more likely to have an accident on a bicycle than on a scooter which you can get off at any point when ridden sensibly.
 
- The Government should consider the reduction of pollution.

attributes.action: Require verified ID for anyone wishing to incorporate a Limited Company.
attributes.background: My business has recently been affected by fraud and the fraudster in question has previously been convicted of and imprisoned for such offences. By using a false name, anyone can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public.
attributes.additional_details: By using a false name, fraudsters can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public. By introducing ID checks on new company directors, fraud levels could be reduced.

attributes.action: Incentivise NHS staff retention by writing off student debt for employees.
attributes.background: NHS staff retention is at an all time low in the current economic climate. A large portion of freshly graduated students are looking for jobs oversees due to a lack of incentive to remain in the NHS and the country. To combat this, we propose eliminating student debt for long term NHS employees.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is for a point based system based on time served. This would mean people would give greater consideration to stay with the NHS for a longer period of time. In return, they would be given a larger reduction in debt in accordance with their time spent in the public services.
In the event of leaving the service, the remaining balance would then be calculated by deducting the  value of time served.  A proposal of 10 -15 years service would see all debt removed.

attributes.action: abolish the housing benefit cap to stop families with children living in poverty
attributes.background: over 400,000 will be living in poverty because of the housing benefits rules this must end to give those affected a chance of living a life without the worry about not having money to give there kids a better life

attributes.action: Make time to debate and vote on Jim McMahon's 'Votes at 16' bill in the Commons.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to make time for the House of Commons to debate and vote on Jim McMahon MP's 'Votes at 16' bill.
attributes.additional_details:
Earlier this month Jim McMahon, the Member of Parliament for Oldham West and Royton, introduced a bill to lower the Voting Age to 16. MPs who didn’t support the Bill exploited an old House of Commons rule that means that Bills that are still being debated on a Friday afternoon at 2:30pm aren’t automatically voted on. This makes it very hard for them to become law. This is not just undemocratic, this is indefensible!

http://metro.co.uk/2017/11/03/tory-mps-accused-of-filibustering-to-block-bill-lowering-the-voting-age-to-16-7052134/
https://www.parliament.uk/biographies/commons/jim-mcmahon/4569
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41862264

attributes.action: Amend the new SDLT rules to include new & existing shared ownership home owners
attributes.background: The new SDLT rules announced in the budget allows first time buyers to avoid stamp duty for properties up to £300k. Shared ownership home owners are not due to pay stamp duty until they staircase to above 80% ownership however they are still liable to pay despite it being their first purchase.
attributes.additional_details: Shared ownership home owners can defer the stamp duty payment until over 80% of a property is owned.  Shared ownership is a scheme used by many young adults to try and get onto the property ladder as a first time buyer. Stamp duty should not be payable for those who are shared ownership home owners on their purchase including when they staircase so are in a position where is needs to be paid for the first time. The new rules need to be amended to cover people in this situation.

attributes.action: Ban spice!
attributes.background: Local towns and cities are getting worse with what we call the zombie plague i.e. legal high SPICE. Businesses are losing out due to people being too scared of this epidemic, less and less people want to go into their local city or local Town! Something needs to be done about this all over the UK.

attributes.action: Teach the law of the UK and our Human Rights mandatory in the curriculum.
attributes.background: I am currently a student at a High School in the UK. I find it shocking that we learn complicated mathematics, most of which would only be useful in careers specializing in it, the history of the world, yet we don't know our human rights and the laws of the country we live in.
attributes.additional_details: There are people being denied their human rights in this great nation of ours, without knowing it. People are being arrested for crimes they didn't even know existed. Why are students being taught about life in Weimar Germany but not the laws of modern-day UK?
